profile.name: Santiago Villavicencio
profile.title: Software Developer
profile.bio: Master's student in Computer Science with 3+ years of professional software development experience. Specialized in automotive software development, cloud technologies, and AI/LLM integration. Experienced in MCP (Model Context Protocol), local LLM deployment using Ollama, LangChain4j with Quarkus framework. Passionate about building intelligent applications and always open to exchanging ideas and collaborating on innovative projects.

experience.description: Software development for the automotive sector with 3+ years of professional experience in Java and cloud technologies. Currently working on team efficiency improvements through VS Code with GitHub Copilot integration
highlights: Participation in all Scrum ceremonies (Daily, Refinement, Estimation, Review)
Processing of user stories and business requirements
Ensuring business logic through unit and integration tests
Analysis and resolution of defects and incidents
AWS cloud infrastructure management and RESTful Web Services implementation
Documentation and knowledge transfer
Exploration of AI/LLM integration for automation and productivity enhancement
Developed specialized VS Code agents and custom skills to improve team productivity
Configured MCP servers through Docker for seamless integration
Worked on 2 additional automotive software projects with focus on system reliability

experience.description: Internship in Portfolio Application & DevOps Services for automotive software development
highlights: Participated in all Scrum ceremonies (Daily, Refinement, Estimation, Review)
Processed user stories and technical tasks
Ensured business functionality through unit and integration tests
Delivered presentations of work results to customers
Analyzed and fixed defects
Analyzed and processed incidents according to Service Level Agreements

education.description: Graduate program in Computer Science with focus on artificial intelligence, machine learning, and LLM integration. Current semester includes mobile application development with Kotlin, machine learning coursework, neural networks, and AI system architecture. Advanced software engineering module focusing on managing complex software projects and career development.

Comprehensive coursework covering algorithms, artificial intelligence, data structures, software engineering, database systems, and web development. Bachelor's thesis focused on practical software development solutions.
